question: List radioprotection agents.
ideal_answer:
Amifostine
CAPE
Melanin
Melatonin
Metformin
Tea polyphenols 
alpha-2-macroglobulin

snippets.text: Amifostine is the first FDA approved cytoprotective and chemoprotective agent in the treatment of cancer.
A combination of resveratrol and 3,3'-diindolylmethane, a potent radioprotector.
CAPE was found to act both as radioprotector and radiosensitizer.
Melanin, a naturally occurring, ubiquitous pigment, has been shown to confer radioresistance, acting as a potential radioprotective agent.
we describe the molecular mechanisms for radioprotection and radiosensitizer effects of melatonin
Metformin as a radiation modifier; implications to normal tissue protection and tumor sensitization.
Tea polyphenols (TPs) have been shown to reduce radiation-induced damage in multiple studies,
Recent studies have shown that alpha-2-macroglobulin (α2M) possesses radioprotective effects.

exact_answer: amifostine, CAPE, Melanin, Melatonin, Metformin, Tea polyphenols, alpha-2-macroglobulin
